newsitem.title: GERMANY: WestLB says Babcock faces drastic cuts.
newsitem.headline: WestLB says Babcock faces drastic cuts.

text.p: German engineering firm Deutsche Babcock AG faced drastic cuts as part of its restructuring, Friedel Neuber, management board chairman of Westdeutsche Landesbank Girozentrale, said on Wednesday.

Deutsche Babcock would have to sell off a number of its subsidiaries, and comprehensive changes in the personnel structure were needed, the WestLB chief told a seminar in Frankfurt on Wednesday evening.
"The group will be slimmed down," Neuber said, declining to put a figure on any potential job losses.
Neuber said he was convinced that the restructuring package would be a success. WestLB holds around 10 percent of Deutsche Babcock.
Deutsche Babcock last week categorically denied rumours on the Frankfurt stock exchange that it was facing insolvency and said that its restructuring programme was going well.

In mid-October the group said it would take a larger than expected charge for restructuring measures. Deutsche Babcock introduced the restructuring plan in July in the wake of losses of 400 million marks in 1995/96.
